name: Euonymus atropurpurea
Relationship: Euonymus Europea-Spindle-tree (liver disorders, biliousness, lumbago, gastric derangements with albuminuria. Cutting pains in malar bones, tongue, penis up to bladder); Podophyl; Ammon. pic.; Chel.; Euonymin 1x trit. (albuminuria).

Head: Pain over right eye extending back through the head
Vertigo, obscure vision and gastric derangement, associated with albuminuria
Headache over eyebrows
Sore, tired feeling; bruised feeling of scalp
Heavy frontal headache
Bilious headache; coated tongue, bad taste, constipation
Stomach: Mouth dry, pasty taste; thirsty, stomach full and uncomfortable
Mind: Mental confusion, despondent, irritable; loss of memory, unable to recall familiar names
Back: Dull pain between shoulders and about renal and splenic region; pain in lumbar region better lying down
Abdomen: Urine scanty, high-colored; acidity increased, poured out rapidly
Diarrhoea; stools variable and profuse, bloody
Constipation with hemorrhoids and severe backache
Extremities: Aching in all joints, especially ankles

details: Brunettes more easily affected, producing headache, mental disturbances and much distress in hepatic and renal region; albuminuria. Migraine. Passive Congestion and torpor of liver; chronic catarrhal affections of stomach and intestines. Weak heart. Chronic rheumatism and gout.
